AT&T’s press release at the time said, “This type of public-private partnership is an example of a long-term, model lease agreement that will deliver digital advancements for the City and its citizens.” Verizon’s Lauren Love-Wright said in a statement at the time the company was delighted to work with the city “to make San Jose a model for the digitally connected city of the future.”

Facebook’s Friday night news dump

With help from John Hendel and Margaret Harding McGill

FACEBOOK’S FRIDAY NIGHT NEWS DUMP — The House Energy and Commerce Committee revealed over the weekend that Facebook submitted over 700 pages of responses to questions from lawmakers following CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s congressional testimony in April.

— The big takeaway: Despite its CEO spending hours testifying across two days earlier this year and the company now providing over a thousand pages’ worth of responses to questions from lawmakers of both chambers, Facebook’s response to the Cambridge Analytica breach looks unlikely to assuage regulators and federal authorities.
